Keywords: Asgardian , Avengers , Deity
Real Name: Jane Foster
Special Powers
LET MJOLNIR FLY: FREE: If Thor hasn't been moved or placed this turn, and if no opposing character is adjacent, generate a Mjolnir marker [MAX 1]. // FREE: Roll two d6. For each d6 result (you choose the order), choose a horizontal or vertical direct path from the Mjolnir marker and then place the marker exactly that many squares away along that direct path. If either path first crosses: A square occupied by an opposing character, remove the marker and then make a close attack targeting that character regardless of adjacency -or- A piece of blocking terrain, remove the marker and then destroy that piece of blocking terrain.
GODDESS OF THUNDER: Charge. When Thor uses it, if her Mjolnir marker is not on the map, don't halve speed.
HAMMER SPIN: Impervious. Energy Shield/Deflection, but only if Thor's Mjolnir marker is not on the map.
Trade Thor Want Thor

If you generate a marker make the free close attack it says return the marker so the marker is not on the map anymore you can Make a full movement charge because the marker is not on the map anymore

April 17, 2022
evil hippy
@Budweiserclix - if you pop out the hammer first before charging - you can absolutely use the hammer that turn - you would be at half movement though - the only restriction on being adjacent to opposing is in the generation part - not the movement part of it once it is out.

Rex Furium
@budweiserclix -- you can't use the hammer if you're adjacent to an opponent. Besides that, I still really like this idea. I've played against Darkseid and I know this power is strong. Especially if you get a map with lots of elevation to use the map to keep Thor safe.

budweiserclix
If you're worried about hitting with the hammer just full charge then let mjolnir fly. That way even if you roll snake eyes for the hammers movement you'll still be able to hit the person you charged.
February 17, 2022
muel0017
[QUOTE=Goop;12178119]It looks like a fun little gimmick to get an extra attack off, you will need a bit of luck with your dice to hit someone. If you dont then you lose your full charge and ESD. I think i would have rather her just had traited flurry instead. This is the kinda power thats cool and fun but very situational and random. You may not even want to do it just to keep the ESD on all the time.[/QUOTE] WRONG. Anyone who actually played Darkseid knows that the Omega Beam ability he had is super easy to use, you just have to know how to position. I ran Darkseid in about 6 or 7 games and every time I rolled for his Omega Beam I was able to hit someone. This Thor will be no different. And say even if you dont hit someone or hit blocking, its all free, you can still charge her in and attack. Darkseid was 200 pts and this is half of that, thats pretty darn good.

Goop
It looks like a fun little gimmick to get an extra attack off, you will need a bit of luck with your dice to hit someone. If you dont then you lose your full charge and ESD. I think i would have rather her just had traited flurry instead. This is the kinda power thats cool and fun but very situational and random. You may not even want to do it just to keep the ESD on all the time.
